#Text=Jury finds two men guilty of Liam Aitchison murder
#Text=Tuesday , June 4 , 2013
#Text=A High Court jury in Glasgow , Scotland yesterday found two men guilty of the murder of Liam Aitchison .

#Text=22-year-old males Jonathan MacKinnon and Stefan Millar reportedly committed the murder on November 23 , 2011 , inside an abandoned building in the village of Steinish on the Outer Hebrides island of Lewis .
#Text=Outside the court , Aitchison 's father Norrie said the guilty verdicts would " finally allow Liam to rest in peace and bring his family some closure . "
#Text=Sentence is scheduled to be passed on the convicted at the High Court in Edinburgh on June 28 .
#Text=The cowards who robbed our Liam of his life and his future should never be able to see the outside of a prison ever again — Norrie Aitchison , father of Liam Aitchison

#Text=Liam Aitchison , who originally resided in Lochboisdale on the island of South Uist , moved up to Stornoway in Lewis and began working as a fisherman alongside MacKinnon and Millar after developing a social relationship with them .
#Text=MacKinnon and Millar were both charged with Aitchison 's murder in December 2011 .
#Text=Having pleaded not guilty to the charges brought against them , the court trial for the two suspects started approximately one month ago .
#Text=The court was told of how Aitchison and Millar were listening to music and drinking alongside MacKinnon in his residence on November 22 , 2011 .
#Text=As " a joke " , MacKinnon punched Aitchison during this visit .
#Text=Upon receiving noise complaints from MacKinnon 's mother , the three walked from the house .
#Text=The court was told MacKinnon commenced fighting with Aitchison after a bottle of aftershave he had apparently stolen from MacKinnon dropped out of his pocket .
#Text=Prior to the murder , MacKinnon had stolen a meat cleaver from a boat he was working on and had been keeping it in his bedroom , the court was also told .
#Text=The exact motive for the murder is unclear thus far .
#Text=Aitchison 's death was caused by him being stabbed twenty times , as well as being hit with a bottle and stomped on his head .
#Text=After he was killed , some items of clothing he was wearing , that he had borrowed from MacKinnon , were removed from his body ; no trace of the items of clothing have been discovered since .
#Text=Police have yet to recover any murder weapons .
#Text=Due to a lack of solid physical evidence , the trial was predominantly inferential .

#Text=The prosecuting side , lead by Iain McSporran , believed Aitchison would have been murdered within a 90 minute period on November 23 , 2011 , during a " communication silence " in which neither of the accused made use of their mobile phones .

column1: #Text=No blood stains were discovered on the clothing of the suspects , although blood stains discovered at the scene of the murder matched MacKinnon 's DNA .
#Text=However , the court was also told that MacKinnon had previously cut his hand in the abandoned building several years prior and that the blood stains could not be dated .
#Text=A key piece of evidence in the trial came from Dominic Long , who recalled how Millar boasted about the murder while conversing with him in a jail .
#Text=Frances McMenamin , QC for Millar , subsequently claimed Long had exaggerated in his recount and was an unreliable witness as he suffered from attention deficit hyperactivity disorder .

#Text=During closing speeches to the jury , prosecutor Iain McSporran said he believed the two accused were " laying a false trail " and had " linked their fates together " because of their conspiracy , while defence QC Frances McMenamin said the jury should not have been looking for " someone to blame " for Aitchison 's death .
#Text=As the jury gave its guilty verdict , a shout from Aitchison 's family could be heard , calling the defendants a " pair of monsters " .
#Text=Speaking outside the court , Norrie Aitchison said his son " fought to defend himself but he did n't stand a chance against the violence he came against that night . "

#Text=After calling the experience of this murder case one which " no family should have to endure " , Aitchison said of the convicted : " The cowards who robbed our Liam of his life and his future should never be able to see the outside of a prison ever again .

column3:
_	_	_	_

#Text=Liam  had his whole life in front of him " , said Detective Inspector Andy Logan , who was the senior investigator of his murder .

column1: #Text=He said MacKinnon and Millar had " completely betrayed this trust , and in a most brutal and callous way they killed him in a senseless and sustained attack with weapons . "
#Text=The Detective Inspector called the murder case " a very rare occurrence in what is normally one of the safest places in Scotland " .
#Text=The crime rate in the Outer Hebrides is amongst the lowest for any region in the United Kingdom ; the last murder enquiry to take place on the islands was in 1968 .
#Text=" It was therefore , very shocking to the close-knit community , " Detective Inspector Logan said .
